tweets.text: @AndynBrown16 @lepdavidnowell @EnvAgencyNW @EnvAgency How much wildlife was killed in the Ellet brook breach in 2015, water cannot get away and  Rufford was flooded,please meet meet me to discuss further

@rpickavance @lepdavidnowell @EnvAgencyNW @EnvAgency Hi Bob. Thanks for your interest. FYI we do carry out a range of maintenance works including vermin control where critical for the safety of defences & where damage puts homes at risk. We do dredge where evidence shows its needed to make a sign benefit to protecting homes. thanks

Shoring up our coastal defences, alongside our partners, over the last 6 years has

üëâReduced #flood risk to homes, businesses & infrastructure üöÑ

üëâHelped fight #climatechange 

üëâMade our coasts a great place to live & visit

Can you guess which scheme this is? 

@wyrecouncil https://t.co/5ZZXsNi1LO

@EnvAgencyMids What are you doing about the flood of gas emissions from one of your regulated sites in Newcastle under Lyme? Anything? Because it's affecting our health and wellbeing. üëø @RedIndustries2 @StinkStopthe @ClareDinnisEA @JamesBevanEA @SimonTagg @AaronBell4NUL

@AndynBrown16 @lepdavidnowell @EnvAgencyNW @EnvAgency This would work a lot better if you dredged the River Yarrow and the Riverer Douglas into which it flows, the Douglas is all silted up, it was last done properly in the sixtes when Skem new town was built, you have no mole catcher , rabit holes, and simular cause the bank breache

3rd day in a row - fresh oil visibly pouring out into tidal Lea. Same private outfall. Strong smell, sticking to walls, birds, everywhere. Lots of people phoning it in. Definitely not swashing back with tide, definitely fresh 'batch'. @EnvAgency @LDNWaterkeeper @Natures_Voice https://t.co/BdgRS1umE5

tweets.text:
Thank you to the members of the public who contacted our incident hotline to let us know a large tree had fallen in the River Idle, near #Retford.

This was a #floodrisk and it has now been cleared.

You can report an incident on 0800 80 70 60 (24 hr service). https://t.co/WsdktEmD0b

We‚Äôve delivered our largest ever programme of #flood and coastal defence improvements!

Working with partners, we‚Äôve helped protect over 300,000 homes from flooding and supported communities to become more resilient to #ClimateChange

Read more: https://t.co/5Bgax4pg9n

#FCERM https://t.co/mS2pKBFb18

I really don't understand why @EnvAgencyMids find it so difficult to substantiate the odour from #WalleysLandfill, wind is from the SW and lo and behold it stinks on Silverdale Road and beyond to the NE. Do you need some help? #StopTheStink @StinkStopthe @ClareDinnisEA

Oh, oh! These don‚Äôt look good!üëÄ

They‚Äôre caused by misconnections, where appliances/facilities at properties are wrongly plumbed into those drains made only for things like rainwater.

It‚Äôs #NationalDrainageMisconnectionDay. When better to find out more? https://t.co/hbBdvpQwBB https://t.co/W4UUhclDvf

A ¬£42m project designed to better protect Hull from tidal flooding is nearing completion. The new defences, which stretch 7km from St Andrew‚Äôs Quay to Victoria Dock, are all now built - reducing flood risk for 113,000 homes & many businesses. Only landscaping work remains. https://t.co/VkkTQfipCY

tweets.text: Today 1,269 oysters are being placed in North East England estuarine waters! 810 housed at Sunderland and 459 at Blyth. These oysters will release over 3 billion oyster larvae into local coastal waters over the next 3 years! #SeedTheSea #OceanRecovery #WildOysters https://t.co/4Mm436rHYD

urls.title: More than 300,000 homes better protected from flooding since 2015
urls.description: The Environment Agency and partners have completed more than 700 projects to better protect more than 300,000 homes since 2015

tweets.text:
Our flood defences in #Mytholmroyd are just one of the many schemes that have helped us reach our target or 300,000 homes better protected from #flooding since 2015. This ¬£41m scheme better protects 400 homes and businesses. 
#FCERM 
#Flood 
#ClimateChange https://t.co/70MVp4EW1K https://t.co/pL6DbQfEqz

The #BostonBarrier is one of more than 700 @EnvAgency schemes which have contributed to better protecting 300,000 homes from flooding over the last 6 years. An incredible achievement & a credit to all of those who have worked to enhance the resilience of our communities. #TeamEA https://t.co/SKNVL6qqOe
One of our appliances and the Environmental Protection Unit (EPU) were mobilised to assist at this incident. https://t.co/AYGteH73PU

It is time the UK had its own rewilding programme for eel in the UK depleted waters @EelGroup we are after support @RewildingB @BenGoldsmith @ScottishEPA @EnvAgency @WetlandsInt @Shoal_Org @WWTSlimbridge @WWFLeadWater @theriverstrust @WildlifeTrusts https://t.co/2t9R4HEbqH

300,000 homes in England are now better protected against flooding. 27,000 of those homes are in the South West, including the  #Helston flood alleviation scheme in #Cornwall which provides increased protection for 121 homes. #FCERM #TeamEA https://t.co/1z6QDFYyBo https://t.co/qqAk6vI7Y3
@lepdavidnowell @EnvAgencyNW Thanks David for joining me in the outside world yesterday! Thanks for this piece to celebrate this great work by #Lancashire councils & the @EnvAgency

tweets.text: @_RobbieMoore @bradfordmdc @AireIncinerator @EnvAgency Your opening paragraph is a complete fabrication of the facts. The application for the incinerator was made by Endless Energy (a private company with no connection to the council). The Council are the local planning authority who have to follow guidelines set by your government.

We've just taken delivery of our biggest batch of electric vehicles to date - 25 electric vans to help us save over 300 tonnes of carbon emissions.

We'll replace all our diesel vans with electric in the next 5 years, helping us reach #netzero by 2030.

#TogetherForOurPlanet https://t.co/eyMQXNY55s

Dirty water from our homes should go to a water treatment works not into our rivers or seas. Wrongly connected pipes cause pollution and harm wildlife. Make sure you @connectrightUK #NationalDrainageMisconnectionDay #BinIt4Beaches #RainDownTheDrain. https://t.co/TxlvkR7FIQ

urls.title: Southampton communities work together to tackle plastic pollution - Preventing Plastic Pollution
urls.description: Community groups and organisations with an environmental interest came together to share their experiences and work together to prevent plastic pollution and inspire behaviour change in the Southampton area. The workshop was delivered by the Environment Agency‚Äôs plastics and sustainability team as part of Preventing Plastic Pollution, which identifies and targets plastics hotspots from river to sea. Workshop attendees had the chance to find out about the impact of plastic pollution, how to organise
